People took great pleasure marveling at this,
For at the time there was no painter

34. All the movements of the limbs
of nymphs, goddesses and concubines
should appear lively and agile,
just as Ariosto describes Alcina,
who never took a step forward
without it being a snare
of Love to capture Ruggiero
with a graceful and charming allure.

35. Another of Pictura’s virtues
is to mimic the distinctions between ages,
particularly to give form to the simplicity of young people
to show their inclination to pleasure,
lively and innocent in all they do.
Also women, unaccustomed to labor:
Her poses are not praiseworthy
If she shows a masculine strength.
left-middleOn giving form to each Figure according to its nature or age.

36. Now, to give our ladies modesty,
we must cross Pliny’s threshold,
and meet a very old example
from an ancient ruined temple,
where one can still see, painted with
incomparable beauty, Helen and Atalanta;
in Atalanta, with a shy, embarrassed and
chaste manner, is revealed the form of a maiden.
left-middleExamples of giving some figures the appearance of honor and modesty.

37. Zeuxis, a painter very circumspect in his art:
his Penelope also serves as a lesson for us,
for in this figure he diligently gathered
together all the gestures of nobility and modesty
which are befitting in a Princess.
Likewise Castiglione does not permit his noble Lady
heavy masculine activities,
only feminine ones, of a gentle sort.

38. Let us depict our maidens and ladies
with a modest manner, to sustain decorum;
though Zeuxis (as we read), elsewhere in this work,
had too much confidence in Homer,
so that he let figures of women exhibit
heavy harsh and rough activities,
which should instead suit mature
young men, or Amazons.
left-middleWomen move and act sweetly and modestly.
